dt.t: houses that were dark and {wi}grisly{/wi} under the blank, cold sky

pt: {sc}ghastly{/sc} {sc}grisly{/sc} {sc}gruesome{/sc} {sc}macabre{/sc} {sc}lurid{/sc} mean horrifying and repellent in appearance or aspect. {sc}ghastly{/sc} suggests the terrifying aspects of corpses and ghosts.
{sc}grisly{/sc} and {sc}gruesome{/sc} suggest additionally the results of extreme violence or cruelty.
{sc}macabre{/sc} implies a morbid preoccupation with the physical aspects of death.
{sc}lurid{/sc} adds to {sc}gruesome{/sc} the suggestion of shuddering fascination with violent death and especially with murder.

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}grislic{/it}, from {it}gris-{/it} (akin to Old English {it}āgrīsan{/it} to fear); akin to Old High German {it}grīsenlīh{/it} terrible
